summary:
Communications professional skilled in identifying opportunities to position brands through a creative yet pragmatic approach. Passionate about multi-platform campaigns that bring brands to life and drive results. 

★ 10+ years of experience gained in Corporate Communications, including Event Management, Brand Management, Media Relations and Project Management 
★ Successfully completed BA and MA degrees in International Communications Management, with a major in Branding, as well as courses in Effective Event Management, Brand Identity & Design Management and Event Project Organization
★ 2 Years end-to-end Event Project Management of the Make the Future Singapore event – a global brand campaign – which counted more than 20.000 general public visitors over 4 days including students taking part in the Shell Eco-marathon, and B2B visitors attending the Business Program 
★ Support and delivery of the 2015 Formula 1 Shell Belgian Grand Prix, as well as management and implementation of the Shell Sky Suite and Shell Motorsport activation for 4 consecutive years at the Formula 1 Singapore Airlines Singapore Grand Prix

projects.title: PR & Communications CvA 2012
projects.description:
All external and internal communications for JCI Haaglanden CvA 2012 congress in The Hague. A national JCI conference with 400+ attendees at the Haagse Hogeschool.
Activities include maintaining press contacts, PR, Social Media, SEO and marketing, promotional materials, congress website and on site (digital) presentations and registration.

projects.title: Organisation of the 24th World Apparel IAF Congress
projects.description: The 24th IAF World Apparel Convention was organised in Maastricht, The Netherlands, on October 29-31, 2008, introducing "Changing Consumer Needs and the Future of Fashion Business". Although TCI is viewed as a traditional sector, innovation and change are as much part of the textile-apparel value chain as of any high tech industry. In this context the Convention brought together a number of excellent speakers from the entire apparel value chain as well as a number of eminent academics who focused upon how the decisions of consumers affect businesses today and in the future.

contributors.headline: CEO, Nota Masselos SA - President, Hellenic Fashion Industry Association
HABEAM Advice and Management Support, Honorary Chairman MODINT and Past President International Apparel Federation

profile_positions.description:
In this role, I manage exciting brand marketing projects that support the growth and success of Olam Food Ingredients (OFI), with the aim of inspiring our customer base about our purpose and vision. To ensure a sustainable, innovative presence at events and tradeshows around the world, I am responsible for driving development and execution of the OFI (virtual) events strategy. 

Everything I work on is in close collaboration with colleagues responsible for product and ingredient marketing of OFI’s cocoa, coffee, dairy, nuts and spices businesses.
profile_positions.title: Brand & Events Manager

profile_positions.description:
★ Communications Strategy: Strategize, implement and drive internal and external communication initiatives; drive Group-wide initiatives; manage external website and intranet; develop, drive and execute multimedia content including print, video, web, social media and other (digital) platforms
★ Content Management: Drive key messages through written and visual presentation of content; develop conference material and press releases; write articles for the quarterly corporate magazine and assist with production
★ Reporting: Project management for the company’s annual and sustainability reports
★ Brand Management: Overall responsible for brand management and compliance
★ ESG: Play a key role in the newly formed ESG team, with a focus on report design
profile_positions.title: Communications and Branding Manager

profile_positions.description:

Coordination of messaging displayed in the MISC Group exhibition booth at Nor-Shipping 2019, as well as coordination of the AET delegation that attended the event. Responsible for media coordination of the first bunkering activity of AET’s pioneering dual-fuel Aframax vessels at the Port of Rotterdam in April 2019.
★ In this role, I had 1 direct report in Singapore, as well as the task of coaching and mentoring a Communications Executive based in Houston.

profile_positions.title: Brand Advisor Exhibitions & Events - Production Centre of Excellence

profile_positions.description:
The Production Center of Excellence (PCoE) team caters for the whole range of services in the area of design, new media and brand communications. 

In this role I have:
☛ Direct control of a large number of visual communication projects
☛ Ownership of projects throughout the lifecycle and direct responsibility for all costs related to the project production

Principal responsibilities:
★ Clarifying the brief, working with the (internal) customer to confirm it, and where necessary shape their requirements
★ Briefing the design and production teams, ensuring they are clear on all key elements of the brief
★ Calculation of costs for each project, discussions about potential cost savings
★ Quality control at the design and production stages, ensuring that the outputs meet the requirements of the brief, comply with brand guidelines and meet standards
★ Liaise with the (internal) customer throughout the project life cycle to ensure they are aware of progress, approvals, costs, etc.
★ Administration to ensure each project is recorded on and managed through the relevant systems
★ Developing and recording project plans for projects and managing resources accordingly
☛ Team focal point for:
★ Information Risk Management (IRM)
★ GTL visual communication (including localization of global campaigns)
profile_positions.title: Communications Production Advisor (Design & Print) - Production Centre of Excellence

profile_positions.description:

★ First point of contact for internal customers

★ Responsible for quality, budget and timely delivery of the project 
★ Brief the design and production teams and ensure they are clear on all key elements of the brief 
★ Liaising with the customer throughout the project life cycle to ensure they are aware of progress, approvals, costs
profile_positions.title: Visual Communications Project Manager/ Traffic Manager

profile_positions.description:
★ Client Management: Acquisition of clients; creating, implementing and executing corporate communications plans; advise on effective projects particularly brand awareness; production of budgets, cost control of projects and budget reconciliation
★ Media Relations: Writing and distribution of press releases; interviews and press events; creation of publishable articles
★ Process Reviews: Creation of corporate communications plans; improved corporate identities; implementation of project management systems
★ Brand Communications: Briefing of design and production teams, timely and on budget delivery of projects; providing advice and execution of social media campaigns; writing of briefs (including agency), creation of project plans and timelines and responsible for these being followed to achieve business objectives
★ Event Management: Project managing exhibitions and events; ensuring strict HSSE guidelines are adhered to; maintaining strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders; wide spectrum of event logistics including guest registration by use of Eventbrite; management of delegate communications
★ Design: Creation of (simple) artwork using Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop, creation and maintenance of websites by use of Content Management Systems (CMS) such as Joomla and WordPress, including online payment implementation

profile_positions.title: Public Relations Manager

profile_positions.description:
During my graduation internship at MODINT / IAF, I compiled a strategic communications 
plan for the IAF. I also worked as assistant in the communications department of MODINT. This consisted mainly of, but was not limited to: 
★ Assisting in the production of internal and external communication such as press releases, mailings, (digital) newsletters, annual reports, magazines 
★ Maintenance of websites 
★ Co-organization of meetings and international conferences 
  
After my graduation internship, I was asked to work part-time for the IAF and put my 
communications plan that I had written into practice. My work consisted mainly of:
★ Contact with members 
★ Compiling the monthly newsletter 
★ Website maintenance 
★ Maintaining press contacts 
★ Writing press releases and articles 
★ Organizing international events for members 
★ Taking of minutes of committee and governing body meetings
profile_positions.title: Public Relations & Communications
